Class ShiftingCaesarCipher

java.lang.Object
ShiftingCaesarCipher
public class ShiftingCaesarCipher extends Object
While the traditional Caesar Cipher 'shifts' a letter down the alphabet, and by knowing the correct shift, you an shift it back the correct direction, a Security.ShiftingCaesarCipher changes the shift amount every so many number of characters. While that means the key could be multiple shift values, this one actually just moves the value up by one for every 5 characters

  • Method Details

    • shift

      public static char shift(char x, byte shift)
      Shifts a character down by adding the byte value to the character, and then casting it back to a character
      Parameters:
      x - the original character
      shift - the byte value to add to the character
      Returns:
      the new character (casted as a character)

    • simpleCaesarEncode

      public static String simpleCaesarEncode(String str, byte shift)
      "Encrypts" a string by going through each element in the string, and 'shifting' the character by the given amount. For example 
           encryptString("Abba", 2); // returns "Cddc"
     encryptString("Ada", 10); // returns "Knk"
     encryptString("Turing", 5); // returns Yzwnsl
      Parameters:
      str - the string to encrypt
      shift - the amount to shift or the 'key' for the cipher
      Returns:
      the encrypted string based on the shift value

    • encrypt

      public static String encrypt(String str, byte shift)
      Encrypts a String using a ShiftingCasarCipher, meaning the the key/shift changes every WINDOW worth of character by 1. So if the key was 6 and window 5, Characters 0-4 would be shifted 6, 5-9, shifted 7, 10-14, shifted 8 and so on.
      Parameters:
      str - the message to encrypt
      shift - the amount of initial shift to start with.
      Returns:
      the encrypted string

    • encrypt

      public static String encrypt(String str, String key)
      Basic encrypt method that takes in two strings
      Parameters:
      str - the string to encrypt
      key - the key as a string
      Returns:
      the encrypted string

    • decrypt

      public static String decrypt(String str, String key)
      Decrypts a cipher which is simply inverting the key
      Parameters:
      str - the string to encrypt
      key - the key as a string
      Returns:
      the encrypted string
